Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email? Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3KS868eemA8eHBg39YmDu2OX41eA4z5RQwh-Nim8yim_po2NGvhbAmlf_GZC_bUWlU0qJ1Gah-2_KC0jFuX9wY6rGgSG-kZfMfuTyRkKvHtEi-d5n3tm8byQNIkyySQ3UU=> .

 

Scaling Native


Adweek's Charlie Warzel talks to a selection of digital-ad-erati in a piece about the evolution of ad units and - buzz phrase of the moment - native advertising. The IAB's Peter Minnium chimes in, "These niche companies [like Appssavvy] hit a core agency and marketer need to get ad experiences in a viewer's activity stream; however, it's still a niche product, only 7-10 percent of the whole market." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3JBDgH8cbd3tM0kNLmL2M28161OwHREQOkpCVagTDnz9GlcNI2WzraxmO9ZIcopRmrDpdgPtyoWZdvx7gdvzDwS2cskdehbkB4KA9lQ9hOmOgjhwUvuqpcvmvtx3HAYWzvCfrzkW-y_rRIUdEizID1Tbz2lOWBc-bIuGtzfiCIWgZFYQwgT_lSYg9DYuZA429fqfKqzD81sqA==>  


Amazon Ad Ambitions


Ad Age's Michael Learmonth reports on Amazon's very public display of digital ad ambitions at this week's Advertising Week in New York City. Learmonth offers details on a presentation by Amazon's Lisa Utzschneider who "said Amazon has actually been in the ad business for six years when it started out with five untargeted ad units. Today the offering includes the log-in page of some Kindle devices, sites like IMDB, Zappos, Soap.com and Diapers.com and deep targeting data based on past purchases. She also showed ads for Sony with a buy button and an ad for CBS Films with a trailer for 'Words.'" Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3L2zG_TpagGUT3PzZ-PohXAwNKRrKVi62tjj7sE-LJCfFTmNAr-zdHL1O1E7lyTwH1mGShiYYDPgt16LqXgU_6-K7QTt6T_cpwjwcJMgY71kZTsrL24QaqLU6h9GC0Df_kuu2mJ1vErQmUTZe5ZfYoJHkqjPsUA_N9DFUFwQwNCRuL3Lh1NYNDBT44P9o1D0LEGRYnT7P5Wck-D9nwUsWjR>  Is this a permanent move to engage publicly about ads? 



Facebook's Vertical Leap

 

Facebook has been restructuring its direct sales efforts around verticals. At an IAB MIXX press conference in New York today, global marketing VP Carolyn Everson illustrated this through the example of telcos, which she says care mainly about three things: branding, new customer numbers, and churn. "I need all my people working on those accounts to know that, cold," she said. Everson was joined by insights guru Brad Smallwood, COO Sheryl Sandberg, and Marc Andreeson. Also discussed were FBX, online GRPs, and the IPO climate. More coverage: PandoDaily <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3LtCiduLKqEWgCEiDEhBVuJTpvJyrDtWm3xqvL3TDaZP7zYk02CT6pDf8hpGlJmZeseu6zNkN3z4YhNoQ7UASAfduTA5zK84BTaiedt8DSWEOhLwqWrCnW5z0Yd-aBjPVMluSfSQsQwQdDj1jKyT7t0C_dA9mD2mHz4g2_p3Rs6stQ5yILdeBYEjd4hZhA_4wCFfyiSu5y2LBPuOv8ez1O-8L56MKgCjasqS_8HznMXxB-Y1p6dUpSWzEnzNduFmOE=> , AllThingsD <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3IZBUV-tpTG-H1NMW28Z-Fa350TstVg5yKOAIngfovyJFPycmG3bAwg3tHQpevUvxRto6WbkXuuaf2I7BakbtjPaUmvGzjVYrTIDn2N2jXMWBI1GAWKQ9QB5YAvZ-5JEjTpKO3bAL8lIu0N0dMBC3h5IQmnLzyMpa3InMGamMliv7M5UKnxwXRWtWcAhG5s8_g=> , TechCrunch <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3JrDr9M3KQVpO4eJjK6vXVzmayVr7t-hNU5pFDti0fK2AAoWBaEnlUGO1DbUm9EtOhZzCKyXiU9lrSSmIiqBMS6GhzRRP7T4NPKU0dNaKxbvJhnHY9XHbLnDS7E6GHFl5DcrWo5id8lp_JNQYjDYSAeIogRo0jHYZwGFQk7qMc6BrfVXbr9N_AK> .

 

Google's Cost-Per-Expansion


Google has debuted a new ad format called Lightbox, which looks like a standard banner that expands into a larger canvas takeover ad. Nothing special about that except for the what marketers are charged: marketers only pay for ads that gets a user to hover their cursor over the spot. Techcrunch's Sarah Perez has the story. Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3KgwRbJCuUKqV0cBDnaTjRA-5P6qg5mDuETn7MPto9fe-4lHnl0pnQVovjEjbnimqhxU9GncyVCu3pzgDQms-RmM2Xrv-uO0t8H4eBbLH6qRMRSaaMYoF2B4saj1YJx4gMR3C-Gkgsd8Ont8sLOxFqQ20BaqPUoxTtebLE5CPYcevpfuP95fVptv79AtDSkoaI2mGzEircR35KCw6FdGr8vvu3bhoEeaNd2126zPlIiWI5217DNt_dI>  In an official blog post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3Iv8qd5kkP6RwEWplpLqfQZpb9Sn0QsNa7TnTGXaBPMIwvsG5u-rSfZ2ow9OR3PQlHFOrhXGj6N5WPwl82Zp1Kyo83V9DOGMWEgLxM59MgtEYJxO27faezrqeas_U9l9fcF3WEbD6mZXGRP0aex39SjEc1CjtKiwxckXQAavOLofg==> , Jim Lecinski, VP for Google's Brand Solutions, answers the inevitable question about "mistaken" rollovers: "In internal tests, we've seen that this smart hover feature eliminates nearly 100% of accidental expansions and increases engagement by 6-8X over standard click-to-expand ads." 


Mobile Flite


Digital ad plaform Flite is "mobilizing" its platform for publishers. On GigaOm, Flite CEO Will Price stresses the benefits of its creative capabilities - Touch Ad Studio - with reporter Ryan Kim, "Having an audience isn't sufficient, you have to come up with an ad format that is not available for ad networks or retargeting media buyers. Right now, publishers are recognizing that without some differentiation at the editorial level and what they offer brands, they're not going to be able to be successful over time." The gap between so-called premium and so-called remnant continues to close as creative capabilities are both improved and simplified. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3JIL4kl-6xr2rQnVWqOUjfb0wPTnN3FGo8Ssvhj73TVw8ZeUxriVzA4cZdrDUcgiur95eu_-V7V-eGl2LuG3MKOORzzb0PZZAi8xX0R6jJxiiiuYl3kY_P77vfNptGPxxsmqIZi44HrBMhQSarIt9aGbh7lY3gx4BZclFVy2sAywZrN472cD6abQCj3giy_7NApZ3BmnWdguv7ySqcWTXWPmjoljgBy9LI=> . And, read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3Kf5mbb_fkgAYZjVsVpqMzVD3rOkNX685xmuZRr_DERV79UThyRiWHizxV2hW-RjVC410x4ZxstnfKey3VKZFju8AuCN38_mClUCBd5uCRyIkr_NS6T0U_HO5yOQI_L-_nZbHv7IhMRBCneAB0urgtAbbB8NHx4-cAjjgKErxVrmQYMSWF4ss-SUjnCMZOELqoXzTxlRgowuQ==> . 


Driving eCommerce Data


Triad Retail Media (AdExchanger May 2011 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3KJoLN304Qr6rL8rB0YmcuYJPU0F7Ug_TUVYQHaMuyCuxTKdzkkV9dLREFFr1QN_n1FZzJC_RXncm8o_Cfs0dRyKbDqnFaUpNpOIhg_Poz49NldxACZQWnoSpTKcbDq3sgKMZOWYcICYHKQBuVXlIiAjtLewwZLdDs=> ), which sells media on ecommerce sites for companies like Walmart and eBay, announced that it has partnered with Krux Digital to get more digital data-driven. From the press release, Triad likes audience targeting: "The Triad Retail Media targeting strategy, powered by Krux, will result in more effective consumer targeting on retailer websites and more efficient cross-web marketing." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3L8eW_syatJW6kuqa_2LdlluzKmJ5v67dSgZVqZA0owyepMrGxIo9BmK9dRU4THU1CHsgjdDoTl1E2DDOa29H8eOp29bMQ5Unbol2dAiVbo03mXOoCtxM_uSCw-xe1PoX6uVOIy3Kjs8wuBUqL-YzelRMDklsz1VmqbMDdztYoPPeT55AFWnTAfArVKezoKQ-0IZZLbuL8LB1nJfcWePc8beOcr468-xMPJQidoNT_wBH2b1J-qmBdCVU40kYN6Dpk=>

Enterprise Ads


x+1 is busy making partnerships with enterprise platform providers of different shapes and sizes. In July, it was Adobe <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3KA-s_x3JgV1bRnFBbLE_g6f4kQhG6qgNvgYMQ2se204cAKVN98Jp_C3MH9QTmwsWBHaSrTfwNp8Zx4hy-tqwVQPZK8RajbO5wF1R-vYa1IyQrpM-317iAOgSPXFh8ydYvE7Fecqc82ubfHTrNmrjEq> . This time it's Oracle as a release announces the integration of tits DMP with Oracle's RightNow CX Cloud Service. According to the release, "This integration will allow RightNow CX users to take full advantage of [x+1]'s Origin Digital Marketing Hub. [x+1] is also now a Gold level member in Oracle PartnerNetwork (OPN)." Digital ads continues to go enterprise. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3K-nnmOzRy_cbcT9M2lKabrDkpMWMdIqDscKTKgV_vSt88__8-QTdrPe4L9HqQahTHfr1K1Qoim3nMlueoTaEQC4cNSThT6uW8y0Jhok0lYytpNrDW3LVqd5ytysx9OR8IZSriPGWd4uVbtX0KE-1zT>  


Truth to Data


It's unusual to find big creatives talking big data, but Ogilvy CCO Steve Simpson did just that this week. Speaking at the BBB's National Advertising Division conference, and afterward with AdWeek's Katy Bachman, Simpson said the complicated issue can be reduced to "respect." He said, "There's a higher burden on marketers and advertisers to provide openness and choice" and, more succinctly, "Advertisers need to stop doing stupid stuff" like failing to allow tracking opt outs or disclose data policies. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001o6sW3umaz3JYLks6pGIId4UEkm7Xy9S2nXIXZpoc6PpGN0CLUmPKEoKsiaquGmEDW_pi2Uy8FRMQmF_z7rax0tPZYHP1uPizbkJe3Vs6oTJ8xMBkGTPl8_RTzEoBlFPxdUS9VN4Dcep2WOyACkQlp1a8J_WyUZpWh9jaIkpQGc6DR6AS2Ed3Wc_-YyH0gWdXWBLnAPMC40KhnBOjiyBiW0F4tGOEPWda>

The Speed of RTB


RTB is still going supernova. In Q3 Accordant Media saw 88 percent growth in real-time bidded inventory year-over-year. CPMs are up 2%, and U.S. remains on top with 47% of global RTB. That said, France, Brazil, Italy, and Mexico are all growing like gangbusters. Press release. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001sSE9lBQYLutV4fibpCTqiJJVzuqk18qyDiU14dKk-ULjqP9hgrwtm5w8YyzI_wIM7Uiq3LCD_TFqUQC3udhlnl-MhTdOu9jPQIsTyBJnxaiS2nbwedJQT4Gzt7WG819vz8T2d4CXXJuhEFeFGZVpBIUTk81tdRdCbbzROp4XQV6Szg-LwhGjZ2wyrsP03KHDNdmUzmsay2rABHQ8yByqlVILvKaDOa0pemdWbj52UIvcCeLg0kXYqXNLYEKjVuuK9s32IwY--UhvQ6LQfQOqktbcRunfqcWnUmCXcyBO6io=>  Mediapost's Joe Mandese calls out that viewability declined as a portion of total spend, down from 32% to 29%. "Publishers seem to be...making the process more opaque and less transparent." Or maybe viewability just isn't growing as fast as the overall market? Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001sSE9lBQYLuu4cZhaoH206uOCEJuWkgv4AoiDO8Ir_twy1Or4itcBXlztsW8eXzdSz-eaBEhseftLLNTfXre78I4EY559SwfjZ4bmQBfbGrUyWlfhhixWIMCJAZ5xIRadSBOQk1OSk9GTfB2A8xrq7wdWVNI-RvjdewweKRvLvOtpuBNN48j0RWf1W7JN4P9CyQX5fufkxZHM2kps16b9GfymGgCPatU__DUg7cb4aC8=>  


Retargeting Foot Traffic


With its new(ish) ad formats, Foursquare is rolling out what amounts to a retargeting platform for the real world. "The initial idea...was that Foursquare could help retailers under who their best customers are through check-in data," CEO Dennis Crowley told an audience at the MIXX conference yesterday, per TechCrunch's Anthony Ha. "Then it expanded by allowing those merchants to track spending, thanks to its partnership with American Express, to offer promotions. Now national retailers (and eventually, local merchants) can pay to get those promotions in front of consumers." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001sSE9lBQYLuur-Eh3kzkUZ-jkV5WAiDdDSOgpX_ESPil3bc_7iUXyF1IUPAWWH1GOm33uldLOO61yhOwIdUyWUD-970RXaq1cyISymF_McHvaL91M5eex71q8Y5YueijgwHqACZ5zoa3HDUiVZ7aAg2n5MiFrBNOb-pkkXcSeqAvYWmwzOyhy9Q==>  


Data Deals Gain


Analytics has been a hot area for M&A activity for years. And there's no sign of things slowing down, according to the latest deals report from media-focused banker Jordan Edmiston Group, Inc. reports. The database/information services category saw the number of acquisitions/fundings up 39 percent, with the value of specific dollar amounts value rising 71 percent in the first three quarters of 2012 vs. the same period of 2011. Additionally, Mobile media and tech continues to be an active market, with deal volume up 89 percent to just over $3 billion. Read the report (PDF) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001sSE9lBQYLusc0ClrbbTuSQpuQBCGL_ZlJXcDgIvJa-8OnDg2bo_W5tEeKqNt-f3sn9sxaJcrygypKFauTpiNJ2be6od5Ij1jPWb2gGUZIohPD7GegKbgHuqLWaPviwwJ6OaBzqSrT1quAU8lNa5lqK1HwtG9ij5fTE8YwJozBEVr9zIqzNTWW3l-ETbhc_EV_KfeBy4-VCw=> . 


The Addressable Gas Pump


Verifone Media Network is offering digital couponing and addressability at the gas pump as a press release claims a sizeable increase in performance over traditional, free standing insert methods of bygone newspaper eras. Jennifer Miles, an exec at VeriFone says in the release, "[Advertisers] are able to leverage an incredible array of targeted solutions, from dayparting and geotargeting at the pump, all the way down to the consumer loyalty ID or the individual SKU of the product they are purchasing - all in real-time." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001sSE9lBQYLuvS_fsoygfmmeCz40sv7qWKZrtI919U7hgpsKnWKfY2u-KyXKqSqCjAuLl2vnZVINvX7xfIqHFh9fBP4ictfPNTExbPgOaBnJlqBpC7ny-OYWRpuZGe306UmbCtRSC_7rlwZgLK15WPAboo0JX9PrDasfs_jz5TIjAbtFXa0pYmNkBCfwS7v_kTwcTiBtW8n4EEIpsB-bK8YteFYOadlw3utt5yuIfWHck=>  Is the pump going programmatic? 

IAB On GDP, Big Ads


Riding the wave of Advertising Week in New York City, the IAB issued two new press release. First, the industry org announced that its latest study by smarties at Harvard Business School revealed the ad-supported Internet was responsible for "$530 billion of the U.S. economy last year, close to double 2007 figures, and accounted for 3.7 percent of the U.S. gross domestic product (GDP)..." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001sSE9lBQYLuvQhFr98aiw1_EDTbVrPyBhil3W72R62x0l-QxMM8iqO1ZkZctjf-9cX8ZF69bqdgV4uczbNqZzNKnCRmlwWtY3qlwU_pVzY5C5cBZw08oHsPo-1yEB_Zk5JamZQ4yyt-Gxs3M_UmFmDocot88SCNsGobBUg_XpXo6RujZgzKUaysRSJdHnt0D3ynKqZ98Rr976cB5UHuiVSHjF6KYza2kb9roX2gqEko4Ve00FTyB6Iw==>  And, the full study is here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001sSE9lBQYLuvsuxQeg1Uj17nb7jjATQGKidIAkLBvSa67q0WSwdCjEbgOKx2tiHzCUUmVUVHUM_52k3AuMrN2PUqvBk-RX2fnqpUFGtMiD0QRH_sCvOkuUsZknd5x-VTP> . The IAB also announced the results of a new brand lift study at that says the new Rising Stars (big ads!) show "big lift across core interactive metrics." See the metrics using Moat technology. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001sSE9lBQYLuuFYvZIQkv22Yuc0ouCmSaag2RTWhbIN1O4-XV3vTHRZhCTJEjW28vkDL40ehWlBZMcuW7hH030fYjnIs-eDZc28CAqilBIyQ8cfMQ5decnFs2AELSwbKp-k9Az79PmC4DEkVgns3JbsdJnpdio9sqTLhYWlSqEeLxSQjFZG8Ut8RWB_ONfq_t1KwFr9f4OWTIRf8l_l9zUqzaXZQReQsOtjPQ3JMlfH4BPQG6bY8Jgdw==>

The Right Data, The Right Person


Data, data everywhere and not a drop to think. Or something like that. Everyone in the digital marketing business marvels/complains about the enormous amount of data available these days. But so few know what to do with it or how to manage the relationships with third party providers. Stephanie Miller, VP, Email & Digital Services at Aprimo, writes in Clickz that "marketing organizations need an operations director in addition to data scientists.... Managing those vendor relationships is one aspect of it, but more important, it's adapting the technology for the specific uses of the marketing department."

Facebook, Ads & Privacy


In response to recent negative reaction to its advertising plans such as Facebook Exchange <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828Y-IDtCAHoxwcj6xQDUqAw9O5BAqyr4UxHvLYQw9cH2HXq4x4uyko93umjfR4Hxu3AzmFq4_niyDV4-9SBekAcYnVoWEnvgFQ35klQD1isOjU8Qa5O4UDPzgwfDBIxEHNwP4RAyjpJ9x8fBxWgkRNZbSA8CqPHWtqZQDFIZ0c9HcxA5e493iWBJJvhs9DEROEY2DvaS3utfDjcbc1kQXCc8>  and its deal with DataLogix <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828aBPqxyD0nBI385m7nbg2Dx9iIml8BPWAJiJjqVfqTHv3Qd8FHfrYaFArvlZqzeH80uGIWX5N4VGssZAT3mGpp3a4BCBVvChrSYWTEJuHw7mUf1hQaKDDdeV5E2aN-NPTtw93DFeK3SJMwB3RxagNWeW0Q85FIg4GcWZkMYeHtxWp3RmNlRG6bo3BkS8Zq-oaU=> , Facebook goes on the explanation offensive, or defensive as the case may be, in a Sunday post. Here's a selection: "When we show an FBX ad on Facebook, it includes an "X" link that lets you provide feedback about ads. We also provide a link that lets you learn more about and choose to opt out of future ads from the service provider responsible for that ad. Also, we only work with providers that agree to technical and policy requirements that protect the privacy of personal information." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828YfCEnlwflPosZNRNBcvooPcn58pkJc9y8PGJl6PG8dqcvWFLC7yykAfY5EOO5nM3s7WuDAPTNwYB2iGNm87JyXbM0hQIPv6cyirQ2x3rphGJOUtgQftCiNjmFVccjT3tBaE1-kd8dkx_UlXwDKg7g5l-SjAv5Xmr61XSH2VTg42c3XJ-tWyNCUP2uTWynJe99mWQuMXRUxvgTq-NWizfel7Yx2mkqXaNY=>  Also, read Facebook's  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828b82npz3G6iyGrMPvPttpzth2kwS3o9bthJhINdEo5j-GPgkccixX0DOeu9TmrdRaN82C8wQG3MIJZ1E8YO_6k4JgRmxy46HJl3MuYpndFJ4uUVUzLC8gkPDMpS0Sf07WsVG1jkBsd-hSCwSNzrwnk0Rfv-ioK_ZU0AI1ajNXpMuA==> "Relevant ads that protect your privacy." For all the work by industry orgs, it will be be the big internet companies that make the case for the future of advertising (FB, Google, Microsoft, Yahoo, Salesforce, etc.). 


Privacy Default


The FTC was on its back feet this week, answering tough questions from several Congressmen about the agency's role in the Do-Not-Track process (AdExchanger story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828Zs9vkzJNcTB05xywV9bMxMLKIILGJHklQhlRARepCzMcSiR6wwQ_c2HluSVy6v-kqEJZjeA7PN0MzG--jPLHyNwIjI--udyzhgyiO0FieKUkuBEeIeeoWNfz7kXwrisKkhGMQJVfTvMOuCvw963v_fBb_-KBpMt-PYWwBv-gwLCoOk7EYwyyPsWZGESPI-vYMDgBQO3h16PViqwu0Xn94AA06mUCXH5aY=> ). Mediapost's Wendy Davis follows up with comments from FTC hairman Jonathan Leibowitz. She Writes, "In their letter to the FTC, the lawmakers specifically asked whether the agency had studied how a do-not-track default setting 'could affect the online ecosystem, Internet users, and U.S. employment.' Leibowitz answered that the FTC hasn't completed any studies on the issue, but said that the agency 'has never called for a Do Not Track by default setting.'" Read more.  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828aZYK8NxMsxmtkJWr4Go1NjNHTflF7nm5tVjz64tgr_Tz-oZp4MScSoimTiN0ecTgvFqOni3qPklj7u6TniyTi9FN-gxBQUIIXkrmcRte_Zq_17Kc2_X4oEMauW8PXyUB_CQu6ImWZbjzA4AFWLvEwtr3ZB-K3msPe-DSXlui1EfAnazLbBR3sBfiksawArajAIPX0QFeWIgkuLYWyJYbasTodJYjf2z4NqS0YAT6b3oW2bkfmmTtrW> And, still more on The Hill <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828Yz-WSgBk3dtuJLZxB65rZgmZdZlrldwTAMzsHHw88A7ttY89lnW8T9oIv_Hqoj-S462SJTP-JQ3JQuZ7Mna8seb1dEmYLj-a5V9kmpi-EApHJu3MPeAvda02TkZBdU2eHk22eMXb96QSPAcPJ4v2H4GwjwJyAgPbu530AbGoCVs7nfINNRV52pAmgISomriCJX7Kn8oKCwziRwihJ6gpsC_2lgWDwAFO0=> . 


Falling Through


Ybrant Digital has been unable to meet requirements of its previously announced $175 million deal with Experian to buy PriceGrabber.com, LowerMyBills and ClassesUSA.com. CNET's Kevin Kwang summarizes the machinations and quotes Ybrant which is apparently still slugging away at closing the deal: "The proposed deal to buy the Experian properties could not be completed within the committed timeline. The company is working toward the same and shall notify the Exchange as soon as some concrete developments occur." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828ZsHmjfOdSC476hkAtqzUx1kGPXp6re--mFlOB7WtTcCciVrjtelEUShOJjNKeuI4wnJng__58w-qxpkBbkf9FCHeFNhGkuSFcF3OYIvzKL6qrEI_K0Ffp3sme6TxRb5bhwdRwQKa_2Y4TSgqitZ61xRZ5IXpKzA4dsLv-oPRR2VmJbIIqHY0wILyQgPYMCdd4=>  


Time Inc 'Big Ads' Strategy


On Ad Age, Jason Del Rey reports on Time Inc's plunge into "big ads" which they're calling Amplify. Time Inc CEO Laura Lang is looking to make her digital mark says Del Rey as he explains, "Amplify will show up as a 300x600 ad unit, built with AOL's Pictela technology, comprising one tile with an advertiser message and another with content from Time Inc. websites. Clicking on the top will take consumers directly to an advertiser website, but selecting the content piece will bring up an interstitial with a marketing message and then the Time Inc. page with the promised content." Read more about it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828Y19q4wICV8CgkzPPvdij4tpxQPWdik56r-IOlHzB2efQIaCb6g3TkAX5C7wbOzhCFZR5vA9zdvwtKpRUH6gcOWDThK-LsJyy07kDx2aO-jdTq8Hrtala9OcwHvGMy2VaT1Lj2AZ8QG8XqjsCeFTjHwFcT61g_jBnT3jBS5KXAAOXA_zjGb0-4Q>  


Private Marketplaces/Exchanges


Belo Corp is taking its network of news sites and creating a private marketplace - or private exchange. PubMatic will supply the techology as a release explains the familiar private exchange/marketplace story, "Belo Private Ad Marketplace was designed to give advertisers direct access to the Company's more than 17 million online consumers each month. The new program will satisfy advertisers' needs to execute programmatic media placements through digital technology platforms, while offering more targeted brand display advertising." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828Yz_CfkhDZB1zQJhw9kiatFi-M8lxXQNjONmK_upGaSYd7aG9lAlPBN4QjE3pPgDiuIxW7qSbcn1HMpJCt2sl9jt3YfdOOgOR0mjGgsPWIu0Exb3FpFQ6e2lsIbBr7ixJ9mtQKScY6QNFZh6oR1JmNOrQ6YuPQK_6F-qzLeU2Dunm1kdTIIqEQJZVGgXFQ4XTVB1zyThiuALTEAJok-kc0zE3L_H_pUyNQ=>

$6k For A Pixel


On his personal blog, Chango CRO Dax Hamman says that he recently came in contact with an agency that offered to put a pixel on a website for an ungodly (or unearthly) sum. He writes, "The client's web agency scoped the project for placing a pixel on the conversion page and decided it is a 36 hour project, which in turn will cost them $6.000..... I was just chatting with a candidate I was interviewing about this conundrum, and even in our wildest imaginations we failed to come up with a 36 hour project scope." See the scoping <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828a_gKfz5YkXL5z79O6-0IYNaArGhKnGWQahVyK_R7MWgYXUtJZZ4rsqg7Ob0_ZnUYg8genUE7l0hW3TJk64UzXKZqC20Ycuj0xwhuyYJARwIHaIDIRsnO42Xk4pZl49MgxKiP4t_s4rtlLXTZz2eIkZIuxca_Qfx14=> . That's a pricey pixel! 


On Abolishing Patents


A new working paper from Michele Boldrin and David Levine of the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis suggests that, maybe, patents should be abolished altogether. Get it (PDF) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828YdMN3FGFjW5eJdUA4vniBH7YUAFENmfRLYMT03JNrAfQrqFZ3C87GWQDYSJtq6pe34Amu-T1QoOrcu8fWS8pPj1_p1LHjTmMxtynC20TC6AqshiciirkyhzW7oDJBxLJ07lQot9gy_A5CiyB7XZy1Y> . The Atlantic's Jordan Weissmann reveals about the paper, "The authors are arguing that, yes, the evidence suggests that having a limited amount of patent protection makes countries slightly more innovative, presumably by encouraging inventors to cash in on their great ideas without fear of being ripped off. But patent protections never stay small and tidy." Read more from The Atlantic. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828ZmoRzFW7VraK54VZx4ckevGomDU5SmLA8ul0kZ8k027aYREzCNOoiIk0MzY3uSq2jK44kffWaHQDh09Ipmbqkn1y-vB1cqspudK4jowUcYpe_xATe5lz6UvQznxLUvv51WMgyE_CSkYv42-iAEjH7GkLotKDHhwtK2gmxhl0yw0dhLdWqpgDow1YTC41SugVn4dFr27yIWrK1diUOrX8R3yBEvjiUbE5FkhN7Py2R_bw==>  


Buy Like


A new study from Adknowledge's Facebook ad platform, AdParlor, says that - no surprise - buying on Facebook is INSANE - particularly mobile ads. TechCrunch's John Constine proclaims, "Pay for a Like through ads and you can market to someone free forever more. With the highest click through rate (CTR) 1.037%, and the second highest conversion rate (CVR) of 65.76%, Facebook's mobile ads are the best bang for your buck." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001apJPZnh828Z9AaE3vAU7MTSG06tXiqqFuyb_bHPUeDN_aUi7-pQN70DcrI8eIoHgr5vS5dCAl53WBSnFh0X1eqWl9QGEiGAmJF-7KVQQUqn14JnoCpnjTEg0nBTqxHXFBVHsZ8wEvwDg6o1cQREpKh5HR_KBHqmqT_HGZXF4sI9EYxxeGWNOvQ==>
